title: Random lockups on Mac, nothing has worked
content:
I've had an issue on my Mac Mini since (I think) I bought it ~1.5 years ago. Firefox essentially stops responding randomly. When it happens, I can usually still scroll through the page, but I'm unable to click on any links on it. Other things like hovering over things that might change color also stops working. When it happens, it happens to all tabs that are open. It usually eventually comes back on it's own after a couple minutes. The weird thing is as soon as I load any other external application, even something as simple as Settings or Preview, Firefox will immediately spring back to life. Only a couple common addons (Ublock Origin) but it happens even with all add-ons disabled. It's sporadic, sometimes I can go all day without it happening, other times it happens every few minutes.

It's persisted through 3 different OS upgrades and countless Firefox versions. I've tried everything I can find about troubleshooting Firefox on mac and nothing works. It's not a resource thing as it happens with only Gmail open sometimes and Firefox being the only thing running. I'm at a loss and looking for anything that might help. I've never seen this issue on other Macs I've used Firefox with.
creator: bhilimon

Any troubleshooting steps would be greatly appreciated.

title: Incredibly slow and eats up CPU memory like mad
content: RE Firefox browser 132.0.1 (64-bit) My Firefox was just updated and it is incredibly slow. Not just the browser, but it is dragging my entire operating system into the mud. I check taskmanager and it is eating up more than a MILLION MB in memory This is simply crazy. I have used Firefox since it was introduced 20 years ago. I swear by this browser and do not use any other browsers But for the past three months every new update and 'fix' has succeeded simply in making everything slower, more cumbersome and essentially unusable! Look I use it conservatively: I ONLY have three addons: Addblock, a youtube video downloader and a video stream detector. NONE of those add-ons usually create that much drag on the system. It's the browser itself that is essentially dragging my computing experience back into the stone age. My entire operating system has slowed down to a crawl. This is not good!!!

Anyway, I wouldn't want to recover my sessions, I'd rather like Firefox not to behave that way. It is possible to enhance Firefox in such a way that it does NOT forget its sessions if the user closes a private window after the main non-private one has already been closed?

Thanks in advance, Dennis

title: Setting tiles
content:
Auf der Firefox Startseite befinden sich Kacheln. Diese kann man mit dem drei-Punkte Menü anpassen. Bei "Eine benutzerdefinierte Grafik anwenden..." erscheint ein Eingabefeld. Wenn ich eine Link Adresse die sich auf meinem PC befindet eingebe erscheint die Fehlermeldung: "Grafik konnte nicht geladen werden. Verwenden Sie eine andere Adresse." Was muss ich eingeben um eine benutzerdefinierte Grafik zu erhalten?

There are tiles on the Firefox start page. You can customize these using the three-dot menu. When you click on "Apply a custom graphic..." an input field appears. If I enter a link address that is on my PC, the error message appears: "Image could not be loaded. Use a different address." What do I have to enter to get a custom graphic?
